page.title: 01SURVEY OF BETHERSDEN
page.content: THE AREA SURVEYED LIES MAINLY IN THE PARISH OF BETHERSDEN 6 MILES S.W. OF ASHFORD AND IS TRAVERSED BY THE A28 ASHFORD TENTERDEN ROAD.THE SITUATION IS WEALDEN IN CHARACTER,THE SOIL HEAVY CLAY.BETHERSDEN MARBLE,A PALUDINOUS LIMESTONE WAS ONCE QUARRIED HERE AND USED FOR CHIMNEY PIECES AND CHURCH MONUMENTS. POPULATION CENTRES ON THE VILLAGE STREET AND ADJACENT HOUSING ESTATES.MOST CONSUMER COMMODITIES CAN BE PURCHASED IN THE VILLAGE SHOPS BUT MANY PREFER THE WIDER SELECTION ON OFFER AT SUPERMARKETS IN NEARBY TOWNS. THE AREA,WHICH WAS ALMOST ENTIRELY AGRICULTURALLY BIASED,NOW HAS SEVERAL LIGHT INDUSTRIES RANGING FROM SPILE MAKING TO TIMBER-FRAMED HOUSING,LIGHT ENGINEERING TO HIGH QUALITY ROCKING HORSE PRODUCTION.VILLAGE SURGERY,HALL SCHOOL,POST OFFICE AND RECREATION AREA ARE SOME OF THE AMENITIES AVAILABLE.
